subject: AI
title: Role Prompting
description: Give the model an identity and watch the output change.

hook.text: 'Explain quantum computing' gives you a textbook answer. 'You're a patient high-school teacher. Explain quantum computing to a curious 15-year-old' gives you something a student would actually read.

buildup.text: Role prompting sets the model's persona. It shapes vocabulary, tone, depth, and assumptions about the audience.

discovery.text: 'You are a senior DevOps engineer reviewing a Dockerfile' produces very different feedback than 'You are a beginner's coding tutor.' Same model, different lens.

twist.text: Roles don't give the model actual expertise it lacks. Saying 'you are a doctor' doesn't make medical advice safe. It adjusts style, not factual accuracy.

climax.text: Use roles to set the right tone and depth for your audience. Don't use them as a substitute for domain verification.

punchline.text: A role doesn't make the model smarter ‚Äî it makes it speak to the right audience.

quiz.question: What does role prompting primarily affect?
options: The tone, style, and depth of the response
